data.name: BigArray
data.description:
# BigArray

JavaScript arrays are limited to 2<sup>32</sup>-1 (=4.294.967.295).
But we want more, specifically up to Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER (=9.007.199.254.740.991) elements.

Your task is to create `BigArray` with the following functionality:

## Constructors
- ```new BigArray()```
Creates an empty BigArray with the default element value of 42.
- ```new BigArray(defaultValue)```
Creates an empty BigArray with the default element value of defaultValue.
- ```new BigArray(defaultValue, length)```
Creates an BigArray with the specified length and the default element value of defaultValue.

## Indexing
Big Array should support indexing like the default arrays:
```
const bigArray = new BigArray();
bigArray[0] = 43;
console.log(bigArray[0]); // prints 43
```

## Methods
- ```BigArray.from(iterable)```
Creates an BigArray containing the elements from the given iterable (like Array.from)
- ```BigArray.prototype.push(element)```
Adds an elements to the end of the BigArray (like Array.prototype.push)
- ```BigArray.prototype.pop()```
Removes the last element from the BigArray and returns it (like Array.prototype.pop)
- ```BigArray.prototype.includes(element)```
Checks if the array contains the given element (like Array.prototype.includes)

## Operators
- ```i in bigArray```
Checks if bigArray contains an element at index i. (like x in array)
- ```for i in bigArray```
Iterates over all indices of BigArray. (like for x in array)
- ```for i of bigArray```
Iterates over all elements of BigArray. (like for x of array)

## Other
- A BigArray instance should have a length property, that reflects its current length.
- The properties of BigArray should be assignable:
```
const bigArray = new BigArray();
bigArray.a = 1;
console.log(bigArray.a); // prints 1
```


## Note
Most features are analogous to the default Array ones. So if it is unclear how exactly something should be implemented, take a look at the default implementation.
